metadata.title: CVE-2021-39714 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In ion_buffer_kmap_get of ion.c, there is a possible use-after-free due toan integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withno additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not neededfor exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-205573273References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39714` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-kvm - 4.4.0-1110.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-aws - 4.4.0-1145.160
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.120').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.160').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
